title: Update needed in javadoc for constructor Image(Device, ImageData)
description: Bug 44164 report, update needed in javadoc for constructor Image(Device, ImageData). The code provided throws an SWTException when initializing an Image object using the provided constructor. The ImageData is successfully created, but the exception occurs when trying to create the Image. The exception message is 'Unsupported color depth'. The provided code snippet demonstrates the issue.
OB: When initializing an Image object using the constructor 'Image(Device, ImageData)', an SWTException with the message 'Unsupported color depth' is thrown.
EB: The javadoc for the constructor 'Image(Device, ImageData)' should mention that it can throw an SWTException with the message 'Unsupported color depth' if the color depth of the provided ImageData is not supported.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Import 'org.eclipse.swt.graphics'. 2. Use the constructor 'ImageData(int width, int height, int depth, PaletteData paletteData)' to create an ImageData object with the desired width, height, depth, and paletteData. 3. Use the constructor 'Image(Device device, ImageData imageData)' to create an Image object using the previously created ImageData.
